definitions.definition: Strict and austere religious conduct.
Extreme strictness regarding moral scruples.
The surrender (of a city, fortress etc.).
The handing over of a person or thing.
Translation between languages, or between forms of a language; a translated text or work.
Formal deliverance of a verdict.
The handing-over of someone wanted for justice who has fled a given jurisdiction; extradition.
An interpretation or performance of an artwork, especially a musical score or musical work.
A given visual reproduction of something.
To surrender or hand over (a person or thing); especially, for one jurisdiction to do so to another.
The belief that proposes the absence and abolition of hierarchy and authority in most forms.
A person who or a type of aircraft that flies at high elevations.
An ambitious person, especially one who takes risks or has an extravagant lifestyle.
A vertical pole used in commercial fishing to locate the beginning and end of a long fishing line.
(usually uncountable) The act of cooperating.
Active help from a person, organization, etc., such as an orderly sharing of space or resources.
Association for mutual benefit, such as for purposes of production or purchase.
That part of a gearbox involved in changing gear, including the gear lever and the forks attached to it.
To shift gears.
To steal in small quantities, or articles of small value; to practise petty theft.
A symbol (=) used in mathematics to indicate that two values are the same, and elsewhere in various other ways, such as (formerly) to separate the signature from the content of a telegram.
Marked or corroded by rust.
Of the rust color, reddish or reddish-brown.
Lacking recent experience, out of practice, especially with respect to a skill or activity.
Of clothing, especially dark clothing: worn, shabby.
Affected with the fungal plant disease called rust.
Discolored and rancid; reasty.
definitions.example: rusty bacon

definitions.definition: A usually alphabetized and explained collection of words e.g. of a particular field, or prepared for a specific purpose, often for learning.
The collection of words a person knows and uses.
definitions.example: My Russian vocabulary is very limited.

definitions.definition: The stock of words used in a particular field.
definitions.example: The vocabulary of social sciences is often incomprehensible to ordinary people.

definitions.definition: The words of a language collectively.
definitions.example: The vocabulary of any language is influenced by contacts with other cultures.

definitions.definition: A range of artistic or stylistic forms or techniques
A hanging down of the head; a drooping posture; a limp appearance
definitions.example: He sat with an unenthusiastic slouch.

definitions.definition: Any depression or hanging down, as of a hat brim.
definitions.example: The plant hung in a permanent slouch.

definitions.definition: Someone who is slow to act.
An awkward, heavy, clownish fellow.
To hang or droop; to adopt a limp posture
definitions.example: Do not slouch when playing a flute.

definitions.definition: To walk in a clumsy, lazy manner.
definitions.example: I slouched to the fridge to see if there was anything to eat.

definitions.definition: To cause to hang down or droop; to depress.
A timekeeping convention in which the 24 hours of the day are treated as a single period, rather than two sets of 12 hours.
Power, especially electrical power, obtained using nuclear fission or nuclear fusion.
A nation that possesses nuclear weapons.
A device in a transmission that disengages the driveshaft from the driven shaft when the driven shaft rotates faster than the driveshaft.
(of a gear) To continue spinning after disengagement.
(of a cyclist) To ride a bicycle without pedalling, e.g. downhill.
(of a motorist) To operate a motor vehicle which is coasting without power, e.g. downhill.
(by extension) To operate free from constraints.
An educational institution providing college education granting certificates, diplomas, and associate's degrees, but not higher level degrees; junior college.
A secondary school, usually offering extended services of some sort.
A man who raises or looks after livestock.
A person who works in a stockroom.
A sudden puncturing of a pneumatic tyre/tire.
A sudden release of oil and gas from a well.
A social function, especially one with large quantities of food.
A large or extravagant meal.
A sporting contest that is decidedly one-sided and whose outcome is no longer in doubt.
definitions.example: The game between the two teams was nothing but a blowout.

definitions.definition: An argument; an altercation.
A sandy depression in a sand dune ecosystem caused by the removal of sediments by wind.
An extreme and unexpected increase in costs, such as in government estimates for a project.
The cleaning of the flues of a boiler from scale, etc., by a blast of steam.
An unsightly flap of skin caused by an ear piercing that is too large.
A gymnastic and recreational device consisting of a piece of taut, strong fabric stretched over a steel frame using many coiled springs as anchors.
Any of a variety of looping or jumping instructions in specific programming languages
To jump as if on a trampoline.
To rewrite (computer code) to use the looping or jumping instructions called trampolines.
definitions.example: trampolined code

definitions.definition: A shop in which bread (and often other baked goods such as cakes) is baked and/or sold.
The trade of a baker.
The actual goods produced in a bakery such as doughnuts, long johns, bismarcks, sugar and glazed twisters, cinnamon rolls, eclairs, etc.
To grant citizenship to someone not born a citizen
To acclimatize an animal or plant
To make natural
definitions.example: Custom naturalizes labour or study.

definitions.definition: To limit explanations of a phenomenon to naturalistic ones and exclude supernatural ones
To make (a word) a natural part of the language.
definitions.example: English speakers have naturalized the French word "café".

definitions.definition: To study nature.
A freezer
The lever used to change gears in a motor car. Called gear shift in the US and Canada.
Worthy of being lauded; praiseworthy; commendable
definitions.example: laudable actions

definitions.definition: Healthy; salubrious; having a disposition to promote healing
definitions.example: laudable juices of the body

definitions.definition: In some bicameral legislative systems, the upper house or chamber.

A group of experienced, respected, wise individuals serving as decision makers or advisors in a political system or in institutional governance, as in a university, and traditionally of advanced age and male.
A ring given to one's fiancé(e) or intended fiancé(e), signifying a promise to wed, typically a gold band with one or more diamonds or other precious stones.
A literary device of writing or art which principally ridicules its subject often as an intended means of provoking or preventing change. Humor, irony, and exaggeration are often used to aid this.
A satirical work.
definitions.example: a stinging satire of American politics.

definitions.definition: Severity of remark.
Food that is unprocessed and unrefined, or processed or refined as little as possible.
definitions.example: Unpolished grains that retained their outer coating were a major lynchpin of his 'whole foods'-based diet.

definitions.definition: Any vessel driven by an engine (either inboard or outboard), but especially a small one.
To press one's face between a woman's breasts.
Infeasible: not feasible.
A multicoloured arch in the sky, produced by prismatic refraction of light within droplets of rain in the air.
Any prismatic refraction of light showing a spectrum of colours.
(often used with “of”) A wide assortment; a varied multitude.
definitions.example: a rainbow of possibilities

definitions.definition: An illusion, mirage.
definitions.example: Many electoral promises are rainbows, vanishing soon after poll day.

definitions.definition: A curveball, particularly a slow one.
In Texas hold 'em or Omaha hold 'em, a flop that contains three different suits.
Rainbow trout.
To brighten with, or as with, a rainbow; to pattern with the colours of the rainbow.
To take the appearance of a rainbow.
Multicolored.
Made up of several races or ethnicities, or (more broadly) of several cultural or ideological factions.
LGBT.
(chiefly of a flop) Composed entirely of different suits.
A person divorced.
One who checks or verifies something.
One who makes a check mark.
The clerk who tallies cost of purchases and accepts payment.
definitions.example: There was a long line at the grocery store because the checker was so slow.

definitions.definition: One who hinders or stops something.
A playing piece in the game of checkers (British: draughts).
A pattern of alternating colours as on a chessboard.
The fruit of the wild service tree or chequer tree, Photinia villosa, syn. Sorbus terminalis

(in the singular) A game for two players played on a chessboard; the players have 12 pieces each, and the object is to capture all the opponent’s pieces by jumping over them. Other European varieties have larger boards and more playing pieces.
(in the plural) the playing pieces in the game of checkers.
To mark in a pattern of alternating light and dark positions, like a checkerboard.
To develop markings in a pattern of alternating light and dark positions, like a checkerboard.
The largest of the apes, native to the forests of central Africa, and known for their trait of knuckle-walking.
A big and brutish man or a thug; a goon or ruffian.
A powerful person or organization; a heavyweight or behemoth.
A lack of security; uncertainty.
The state of being subject to danger; vulnerability.
A semicircular projection from a building, especially the rounded east end of a church that contains the altar.
The bishop's seat or throne in ancient churches.
A reliquary, or case in which the relics of saints were kept.
The nearest and furthest points to the centre of gravitational attraction for a body in orbit. More usually called an apsis.
An aspen tree.
A sudden or unsteady movement.
definitions.example: the lurch of a ship, or of a drunkard

definitions.definition: To make such a sudden, unsteady movement.
To swallow or eat greedily; to devour; hence, to swallow up.
An old game played with dice and counters; a variety of the game of tables.
A double score in cribbage for the winner when his/her adversary has been left in the lurch.
To leave someone in the lurch; to cheat.
To rob.
To evade by stooping; to lurk.
A place where animals are slaughtered.
The scene of a massacre.

A disease characterised by inflammation of the intestines, especially the colon (large intestine), accompanied by pus (white blood cells) in the feces, fever, pain in the abdomen, high volume of diarrhea, and possible blood in the feces.
Diarrhea
Any one of the species of large odd-toed ungulates of the taxonomic family Tapiridae with a long prehensile upper lip, of which all four surviving species are in genus Tapirus.
A musical instrument of the percussion idiophone family of instruments; like the xylophone, it has tuned bars arranged like the keys on a piano, and is also smaller in size and higher in pitch.
To throw over the edge of a boat into the water.
Outside of a boat, in the water
Over the edge; especially, off or outside of a boat.
definitions.example: It was their practice to throw the scraps overboard.

definitions.definition: Excessively; too much.
definitions.example: They really went overboard with the party preparations.

definitions.definition: A place where distillation takes place, especially the distillation of alcoholic spirits.
A company that distills alcohol.
The process of distilling alcohol.
Too confident.
Presumptuous, cocksure, rude and disrespectful.
A lazy and/or irresponsible person who is often unemployed, often depending upon wealthy or otherwise financially independent people for support.
A person who defaults on debts.
Something which is not a binary (executable computer file).
A genderqueer person.
Not binary.
(transgender) Having or pertaining to a gender identity not represented by the gender binary; not exclusively male or female; genderqueer.
A Classical comic actor, especially one who works mainly through gesture and mime.
The drama in ancient Greece and Rome featuring such performers; or (later) any of various kinds of performance modelled on such work.

A traditional theatrical entertainment, originally based on the commedia dell'arte, but later aimed mostly at children and involving physical comedy, topical jokes, call and response, and fairy-tale plots.
Gesturing without speaking; dumb-show, mime.
To make (a gesture) without speaking.
definitions.example: I pantomimed steering a car; he understood, and tossed the keys to me.

definitions.definition: To entertain others by silent gestures or actions.
Any edible animal from sub-Saharan Africa's dense forest that is not traditionally regarded as game.
One who loots, who steals during a general disturbance such as a riot or natural disaster.
definitions.example: After the hurricane, before law was restored, looters stole everything that wasn't nailed down.

definitions.definition: An animal without vertebrae, i.e. backbone.
A spineless person; a coward.
Lacking a backbone.
The segregation of people of different colour or race, especially any barrier to black people participating in activities with white people.
A pattern of varying tonal density that enables visual and numeric comparisons to be made across multiple printed sheets or pages.
(jewellery) In a rough opal: a layer of good jewellery-quality opal.
Bring-and-buy
A vessel riding at anchor and displaying a light for the guidance of sailors, in a position where a fixed lighthouse structure would be impracticable.
Women's clothing, particularly in a retail context.
The use of a thick-bodied paint to create sizable peaks and crests in an image.
To paint in thick-bodied paint; to paint in impasto style
A park where live animals are exhibited.
Any place that is wild, crowded, or chaotic.
definitions.example: The shopping center was a zoo the week before Christmas.

definitions.definition: The jungle.
The red panda (Ailurus fulgens), a small raccoon-like animal of northeast Asia with reddish fur and a long, ringed tail.
Short for giant panda.
(law enforcement) Short for panda car.
A brahmin who acts as the hereditary superintendent of a particular ghat or temple, and is regarded as knowledgeable in matters of genealogy and ritual.
A husband who remains in the homestead as housekeeper, as opposed to a housewife.
Any of a group of similar brass instruments, resembling a bugle in shape, but with valves
A young female cow, (particularly) one over one year old but which has not calved.
A wife.
A girl.
A cow: a large, unattractive, unpleasant woman.
A substitute (usually of a person, position or role).
definitions.example: A mixture of horseradish and mustard often serves as a surrogate for wasabi.

definitions.definition: A person or animal that acts as a substitute for the social or pastoral role of another, such as a surrogate parent.
A deputy for a bishop in granting licences for marriage.
A politician or person of influence campaigning for a presidential candidate.
A judicial officer of limited jurisdiction, who administers matters of probate and interstate succession and, in some cases, adoptions.
Any of a range of Unicode codepoints which are used in pairs in UTF-16 to represent characters beyond the Basic Multilingual Plane.
An ersatz good.
To replace or substitute something with something else; to appoint a successor.
Of, concerning, relating to or acting as a substitute.
A unique identifier for an entity or object, not derived from application data.
An individual who has anemia.
Of, pertaining to, or suffering from anemia.
(by extension) Weak; listless; lacking power, vigor, vitality, or colorfulness.
An epithet granted in India and Tibet to people thought to have great knowledge and love of humanity
Such a person.
A person who carries luggage and related objects.
definitions.example: By the time I reached the train station I was exhausted, but fortunately there was a porter waiting.

definitions.definition: An ant having the specialized role of carrying.
One who ports software (makes it usable on another platform).
A person in control of the entrance to a building.
An employee who clears and cleans tables and puts bowling balls away.
A strong, dark ale, originally favored by porters, similar to a stout but less strong.
Stout (malt brew).
To serve as a porter; to carry.
A tree, Olea europaea, cultivated since ancient times in the Mediterranean for its fruit and the oil obtained from it.
The small oval fruit of this tree, eaten ripe (usually black) or unripe (usually green).
The wood of the olive tree.
A dark yellowish-green color, that of an unripe olive.
An olivary body, part of the medulla oblongata.
A component of a plumbing compression joint; a ring which is placed between the nut and the pipe and compressed during fastening to provide a seal.
A small slice of meat seasoned, rolled up, and cooked.
definitions.example: a beef olive

definitions.definition: Any shell of the genus Oliva and allied genera; so called from the shape.
An oystercatcher, a shore bird.
Of a grayish green color, that of an unripe olive.
A marine crustacean of the subclass Cirripedia that attaches itself to submerged surfaces such as tidal rocks or the bottoms of ships.
The barnacle goose.
In electrical engineering, a change made to a product on the manufacturing floor that was not part of the original product design.
On printed circuit boards, a change such as soldering a wire in order to connect two points, or addition such as an added resistor or capacitor, subassembly or daughterboard.
A deprecated or obsolete file, image or other artifact that remains with a project even though it is no longer needed.
(in the plural) An instrument like a pair of pincers, to fix on the nose of a vicious horse while shoeing so as to make it more tractable.
(in the plural) A pair of spectacles.
A good job, or snack easily obtained.
A worldly sailor.
To connect with or attach.
To press close against something.
The aft part of the upper deck of a ship; normally reserved for officers
The act or art of declaiming; rhetorical delivery; loud speaking in public.
A set or harangue; declamatory discourse.
Pretentious rhetorical display, with more sound than sense.
definitions.example: mere declamation

definitions.definition: (British commonwealth) Loyal Orange Lodge, a prefix given to all branches of the Loyal Orange Order. For example, LOL 1 is Portadown branch.
(sometimes derogatory) Little old lady.
To laugh out loud.
Laughing (or laugh) out loud.
Lots of laughs. (occasionally used)
(by dilution) Indicates light-heartedness or amusement, or that the accompanying statement is not intended as serious.
(letter-writing) Lots of love.
Used in song as a nonsense syllable.
Someone who attacks or assails another violently, or criminally.
(by extension) A hostile critic or opponent.
Assailing; attacking.
An injury suffered as a result of freezing of some part of the body, typically fingers, toes or the nose.
To expose to the effect of frost, or a frosty air; to blight or nip with frost.
To engage in winter sailboating.
A type of reception or party whereby the host says they will be ‘at home’ during specific hours, when guests can come and go as they like.
One of the bowls used in the French game of boules.
A single-crystal ingot produced by synthetic means.
A round loaf of bread.
A round piece of dough.
A through-sawn log with the slices restacked in the order and orientation they originally had in the log, usually with waney edges.
To shape (a piece of dough) into a ball.
A particularly decorative piece of brass or other material, used as inlay in furniture or other works.
Furniture having ornamentation of this kind.
A council of citizens in Ancient Greece
Someone who shares in the parenting of a child or children, such as:
definitions.example: a parent in a same-sex couple

definitions.definition: To act as a co-parent, to share custody of a child or children, to share in the responsibility of parenting a child or children
The sport of skiing in a zigzag course through gates. (Often used attributively)
definitions.example: Slalom is her strongest Olympic sport.

definitions.definition: Any similar activity on other vehicles, including canoes and water skis.
A course used for the sport of slalom.
definitions.example: These first two slaloms have sixty gates each.

definitions.definition: A race or competition wherein participants each perform the sport of slalom.
definitions.example: He has won six World Cup slaloms.

definitions.definition: To race in a slalom.
To move in a slalom-like manner.
A written defense of a position or belief.
definitions.example: Although I've enumerated some of the academic traditions and debates that have animated this book, it is not my purpose to offer a full apologia in these brief pages. - 1999 Preface from "Gender Trouble" by Judith Butler

definitions.definition: Any of very many forms of rice that are first cooked by boiling and then stir-fried with other ingredients
Any event lasting one day.
definitions.example: Is the conference going to be a one-dayer, or should we book a hotel room?
